Description: Regulation in the EU focused on data protection and privacy for individuals, also addressing the export of personal data outside the EU.
California state law that provides residents with rights over their personal data, including the right to know, delete, and opt-out of the sale of their data.

Framework: HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act)
Description: U.S. law that mandates secure handling of individuals' health information, applicable to healthcare providers and related entities.
U.S. federal law that sets requirements for financial practices and reporting, including the protection of data in financial systems.

Framework: PCI DSS (Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard)
Description: Set of security standards designed to ensure that all companies that process, store, or transmit credit card information maintain a secure environment.
International standard for information security management systems, providing a framework to protect sensitive company information.

Framework: NIST CSF (National Institute of Standards and Technology Cybersecurity Framework)
Description: Framework developed by NIST to guide organizations in managing and reducing cybersecurity risks.

Framework: FERPA (Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act)
Description: U.S. federal law that protects the privacy of student education records, applicable to all schools that receive funding from the U.S. Department of Education.
Framework for managing and safeguarding customer data, commonly used by technology and cloud computing companies to ensure compliance with data privacy and security standards.

Framework: PIPEDA (Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act)
Description: Canadian law governing how private sector organizations collect, use, and disclose personal information in the course of commercial business.
